channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: ConceptHash: Interpretable Fine-Grained Hashing via Concept Discovery
item.description: Code at: https://github. com/kamwoh/concepthash.

item.title: Semi-Supervised Spoken Language Glossification
item.description: Spoken language glossification (SLG) aims to translate the spoken language text into the sign language gloss, i. e., a written record of sign language.

item.title: GUI Odyssey: A Comprehensive Dataset for Cross-App GUI Navigation on Mobile Devices
item.description: Smartphone users often navigate across multiple applications (apps) to complete tasks such as sharing content between social media platforms.

item.title: DafnyBench: A Benchmark for Formal Software Verification
item.description: We introduce DafnyBench, the largest benchmark of its kind for training and evaluating machine learning systems for formal software verification.

item.title: Large Language Models Must Be Taught to Know What They Don't Know
item.description: We show that a thousand graded examples are sufficient to outperform baseline methods and that training through the features of a model is necessary for good performance and tractable for large open-source models when using LoRA.

item.title: AWGUNET: Attention-Aided Wavelet Guided U-Net for Nuclei Segmentation in Histopathology Images
item.description: Accurate nuclei segmentation in histopathological images is crucial for cancer diagnosis.

item.title: A deep cut into Split Federated Self-supervised Learning
item.description: Collaborative self-supervised learning has recently become feasible in highly distributed environments by dividing the network layers between client devices and a central server.

item.title: Real-world Image Dehazing with Coherence-based Label Generator and Cooperative Unfolding Network
item.description: Real-world Image Dehazing (RID) aims to alleviate haze-induced degradation in real-world settings.

item.title: Tell Me What's Next: Textual Foresight for Generic UI Representations
item.description: Mobile app user interfaces (UIs) are rich with action, text, structure, and image content that can be utilized to learn generic UI representations for tasks like automating user commands, summarizing content, and evaluating the accessibility of user interfaces.

item.title: Designing a Dashboard for Transparency and Control of Conversational AI
item.description: The dashboard can also be used to control the user model and the system's behavior.

item.title: BookSQL: A Large Scale Text-to-SQL Dataset for Accounting Domain
item.description: Several large-scale datasets (e. g., WikiSQL, Spider) for developing natural language interfaces to databases have recently been proposed.

item.title: DemosaicFormer: Coarse-to-Fine Demosaicing Network for HybridEVS Camera
item.description: Coarse demosaicing network is designed to produce a preliminary high-quality estimate of the RGB image from the HybridEVS raw data while the pixel correction network enhances the performance of image restoration and mitigates the impact of defective pixels.

item.title: Reinforcement Learning to Disentangle Multiqubit Quantum States from Partial Observations
item.description: We present a deep reinforcement learning (RL) approach to constructing short disentangling circuits for arbitrary 4-, 5-, and 6-qubit states using an actor-critic algorithm.

item.title: LaMOT: Language-Guided Multi-Object Tracking
item.description: In this paper, we address this challenge by introducing Language-Guided MOT, a unified task framework, along with a corresponding large-scale benchmark, termed LaMOT, which encompasses diverse scenarios and language descriptions.

item.title: Accurate Explanation Model for Image Classifiers using Class Association Embedding
item.description: Recombining the individual code of a given sample with altered class-associated code leads to a synthetic real-looking sample with preserved individual characters but modified class-associated features and possibly flipped class assignments.

item.title: Spoof Diarization: "What Spoofed When" in Partially Spoofed Audio
item.description: As a pioneering study in spoof diarization, we focus on defining the task, establishing evaluation metrics, and proposing a benchmark model, namely the Countermeasure-Condition Clustering (3C) model.

item.title: Label-aware Hard Negative Sampling Strategies with Momentum Contrastive Learning for Implicit Hate Speech Detection
item.description: Detecting implicit hate speech that is not directly hateful remains a challenge.

item.title: M3T: A New Benchmark Dataset for Multi-Modal Document-Level Machine Translation
item.description: Document translation poses a challenge for Neural Machine Translation (NMT) systems.

item.title: LibriTTS-P: A Corpus with Speaking Style and Speaker Identity Prompts for Text-to-Speech and Style Captioning
item.description: We employ a hybrid approach to construct prompt annotations: (1) manual annotations that capture human perceptions of speaker characteristics and (2) synthetic annotations on speaking style.

item.title: SHACL2FOL: An FOL Toolkit for SHACL Decision Problems
item.description: Continuing on this line of research, we introduce SHACL2FOL, the first automatic tool that (i) translates SHACL documents into FOL sentences and (ii) computes the answer to the two static analysis problems of satisfiability and containment; it also allow to test the validity of a graph with respect to a set of constraints.

item.title: Carbon Market Simulation with Adaptive Mechanism Design
item.description: \textit{Cap and trade} stands as a critical principle based on allocating and trading carbon allowances (carbon emission credit), enabling economic agents to follow planned emissions and penalizing excess emissions.

item.title: Multimodal Table Understanding
item.description: Although great progress has been made by previous table understanding methods including recent approaches based on large language models (LLMs), they rely heavily on the premise that given tables must be converted into a certain text sequence (such as Markdown or HTML) to serve as model input.

item.title: RRLS : Robust Reinforcement Learning Suite
item.description: We introduce the Robust Reinforcement Learning Suite (RRLS), a benchmark suite based on Mujoco environments.

item.title: Causality for Tabular Data Synthesis: A High-Order Structure Causal Benchmark Framework
item.description: In this paper, we introduce high-order structural causal information as natural prior knowledge and provide a benchmark framework for the evaluation of tabular synthesis models.

item.title: KernelWarehouse: Rethinking the Design of Dynamic Convolution
item.description: Dynamic convolution learns a linear mixture of n static kernels weighted with their input-dependent attentions, demonstrating superior performance than normal convolution.

item.title: Judging the Judges: A Systematic Investigation of Position Bias in Pairwise Comparative Assessments by LLMs
item.description: Our study investigates this issue by developing a framework to systematically study and quantify position bias using metrics such as repetitional consistency, positional consistency, and positional fairness.

item.title: OpenCOLE: Towards Reproducible Automatic Graphic Design Generation
item.description: Automatic generation of graphic designs has recently received considerable attention.

item.title: Are Large Language Models Good Statisticians?
item.description: Large Language Models (LLMs) have demonstrated impressive capabilities across a range of scientific tasks including mathematics, physics, and chemistry.

item.title: On Evaluating Adversarial Robustness of Volumetric Medical Segmentation Models
item.description: We extend this investigation across four volumetric segmentation datasets, evaluating robustness under both white box and black box adversarial attacks.

item.title: When Do Skills Help Reinforcement Learning? A Theoretical Analysis of Temporal Abstractions
item.description: Skills are temporal abstractions that are intended to improve reinforcement learning (RL) performance through hierarchical RL.

item.title: OpenObj: Open-Vocabulary Object-Level Neural Radiance Fields with Fine-Grained Understanding
item.description: In recent years, there has been a surge of interest in open-vocabulary 3D scene reconstruction facilitated by visual language models (VLMs), which showcase remarkable capabilities in open-set retrieval.

item.title: It Takes Two: On the Seamlessness between Reward and Policy Model in RLHF
item.description: We validate the effectiveness of SEAM in data selection and model augmentation.

item.title: MMWorld: Towards Multi-discipline Multi-faceted World Model Evaluation in Videos
item.description: Multimodal Language Language Models (MLLMs) demonstrate the emerging abilities of "world models" -- interpreting and reasoning about complex real-world dynamics.

item.title: SimSAM: Simple Siamese Representations Based Semantic Affinity Matrix for Unsupervised Image Segmentation
item.description: Recent developments in self-supervised learning (SSL) have made it possible to learn data representations without the need for annotations.

item.title: OmniCorpus: An Unified Multimodal Corpus of 10 Billion-Level Images Interleaved with Text
item.description: In this paper, we introduce OmniCorpus, a 10 billion-scale image-text interleaved dataset.

item.title: The Max-Min Formulation of Multi-Objective Reinforcement Learning: From Theory to a Model-Free Algorithm
item.description: In this paper, we consider multi-objective reinforcement learning, which arises in many real-world problems with multiple optimization goals.

item.title: Legend: Leveraging Representation Engineering to Annotate Safety Margin for Preference Datasets
item.description: By leveraging this safety direction, Legend can then leverage the semantic distances of paired responses along this direction to annotate margins automatically.

item.title: GraphFM: A Comprehensive Benchmark for Graph Foundation Model
item.description: To address these questions, we have constructed a rigorous benchmark that thoroughly analyzes and studies the generalization and scalability of self-supervised Graph Neural Network (GNN) models.

item.title: One-Step Effective Diffusion Network for Real-World Image Super-Resolution
item.description: Our experiments demonstrate that OSEDiff achieves comparable or even better Real-ISR results, in terms of both objective metrics and subjective evaluations, than previous diffusion model based Real-ISR methods that require dozens or hundreds of steps.

item.title: Benchmarking Vision-Language Contrastive Methods for Medical Representation Learning
item.description: We perform a comprehensive benchmarking of contrastive frameworks for learning multimodal representations in the medical domain.

item.title: MR-RawNet: Speaker verification system with multiple temporal resolutions for variable duration utterances using raw waveforms
item.description: In speaker verification systems, the utilization of short utterances presents a persistent challenge, leading to performance degradation primarily due to insufficient phonetic information to characterize the speakers.

item.title: CAAP: Context-Aware Action Planning Prompting to Solve Computer Tasks with Front-End UI Only
item.description: Software robots have long been deployed in Robotic Process Automation (RPA) to automate mundane and repetitive computer tasks.

item.title: Vision Model Pre-training on Interleaved Image-Text Data via Latent Compression Learning
item.description: Recently, vision model pre-training has evolved from relying on manually annotated datasets to leveraging large-scale, web-crawled image-text data.

item.title: RWKV-CLIP: A Robust Vision-Language Representation Learner
item.description: Contrastive Language-Image Pre-training (CLIP) has significantly improved performance in various vision-language tasks by expanding the dataset with image-text pairs obtained from websites.

item.title: Ollabench: Evaluating LLMs' Reasoning for Human-centric Interdependent Cybersecurity
item.description: OllaBench is built on a foundation of 24 cognitive behavioral theories and empirical evidence from 38 peer-reviewed papers.

item.title: AudioMarkBench: Benchmarking Robustness of Audio Watermarking
item.description: The increasing realism of synthetic speech, driven by advancements in text-to-speech models, raises ethical concerns regarding impersonation and disinformation.

item.title: StreamPrompt: Learnable Prompt-guided Data Selection for Efficient Stream Learning
item.description: Moreover, StreamPrompt introduces Prompt Attunement, a mechanism that enhances the efficiency of prompt learning.

item.title: AsyncDiff: Parallelizing Diffusion Models by Asynchronous Denoising
item.description: To address this, we introduce AsyncDiff, a universal and plug-and-play acceleration scheme that enables model parallelism across multiple devices.

item.title: Open-LLM-Leaderboard: From Multi-choice to Open-style Questions for LLMs Evaluation, Benchmark, and Arena
item.description: To address them, a more thorough approach involves shifting from MCQ to open-style questions, which can fundamentally eliminate selection bias and random guessing issues.

item.title: Semantic-Aware Spectrum Sharing in Internet of Vehicles Based on Deep Reinforcement Learning
item.description: This optimization encompasses the optimal link of V2V and V2I sharing strategies, the transmission power for vehicles sending semantic information and the length of transmitted semantic symbols, aiming at maximizing HSSE of V2I and enhancing success rate of effective semantic information transmission (SRS) of V2V.
